project_abstract.cdata: The Labor Force Development Project in Benin, will assist in the start up, and pilot testing of a new government program that aims at: increasing the availability, quality, and cost effectiveness of labor force training; and, at strengthening the public sector capacity to monitor, and evaluate labor force training needs, and, at improving the private sector training capacity. The components will: 1) provide training grants to workers in the informal, and modern sectors, and to selected, new labor force participants. Priority training programs will be identified, and subsequently, contract the provision of training with qualified providers. Training proposals will be evaluated on the basis of economic interest, social equity, technical feasibility, cost estimates, and financial planning; 2) develop a strong monitoring, and evaluation system, to generate timely information on the implementation of the training program, on the market for training, i.e., beneficiary groups' knowledge, and appreciation of the Fund's program, and, on the impact of training. Longitudinal studies will measure the economic impact, to allow progressive policy adjustments, and rationalized financial allocations; and, 3) will strengthen the institutional development of the Fonds de Developpement de la Formation Professionnelle Continue et de l'Apprentissage, and finance overseas study, training, and technical assistance.
